events.message: The customer reported a car collision that occurred on 2024-05-30 involving their vehicle and a stationary object, filing the claim promptly.
The claim was reviewed and categorized under Auto Accident after verifying the incident details related to a vehicle collision.
An agent with expertise in automotive claims was assigned promptly to handle the case and assist the customer through the process.
The insurance provider officially acknowledged receipt of the claim and assured the customer that the case will be investigated accordingly.
The agent requested the customer to submit photographs of the damaged vehicle and the police collision report for further processing.
Customer provided all requested documentation promptly, including photos from the accident scene and the official police report.
The claim investigation began with an assigned adjuster reviewing the submitted evidence and scheduling an inspection of the vehicle.
After thorough inspection and review, the investigation was finalized, confirming the damage was consistent with the described collision.
A settlement offer was proposed based on the damage assessment and policy coverage limits for repairs to the customer's vehicle.
The customer expressed dissatisfaction with the proposed settlement amount, feeling it did not fully cover all necessary repairs.
Due to customer concerns, the claim was escalated for a secondary review by the claims supervisor to ensure an accurate settlement.
Following reassessment, the claim was approved with an increased settlement offer that better reflected the repair estimates.
The approved settlement payment was processed and issued to the customerâ€™s account to cover the vehicle repair costs.
The claim was officially closed after confirmation that the customer received the settlement and the repair work commenced.
